title: News24.com | Weather Update: More rain, extreme fire dangers heading for SA
text:
{{item.title}} 
Cape Town - The South African Weather Service has issued an alert for heavy rains with the risk of localised flooding over the western parts of the North West province, central and south-eastern parts of the Free State as well as the south-western parts of KwaZulu-Natal. 
Early on Tuesday, 7 February, heavy rainfall leading to localised flooding can be expected over the area as 80% chance of rain has been forecast in the region. 
Over the adjacent areas in the Free State, KZN as well as the north-eastern parts of the Eastern Cape and south-western parts of Gauteng, a 60% chance of rain is expected. 
The rain will continue in the central and northern parts of SA until mid-week, the SA Weather Service says. 
A 30% chance of rain exists over the central and eastern parts of the Northern Cape and most of the Eastern Cape. A 30% chance of rain is also expected along the southern coastline of the Western Cape, while the entire Western Cape and Northern Cape is currently in the grip of a severe water shortage. 
Extremely high fire dangers 
In the midst of the drought, the SA Weather Service has also issued an alert for extremely high fire danger conditions expected in places over the southern and south-eastern parts of the Northern Cape, Central Karoo and Breede Valley of the Western Cape, as well as the western and north-western parts of the Eastern Cape for Tuesday.

Temperatures 
Temperatures across the country on Tuesday will be cool to warm, except in the central parts of the Western Cape as well as in the Northern Cape where it will be hot to very hot. 
Johannesburg in Gauteng will reach a high of 24°C, while Pretoria will be 28°C and Bloemfontein in the Free State will peak at 28°C. 
Beaufort West in the Western Cape will be the hottest place in SA on Tuesday with a high of 39°C expected.

Along the rest of the coastal regions of SA, Cape Town will reach a high of 22°C, while Durban on the East Coast can expect a high of 28°C. Port Elizabeth in the Eastern Cape will see a high of 31°C.
